title: Amazing Grace
lyrics:
[C]Amazing grace, how [G]sweet the sound
[A7]That saved a wretch like [F]me
[C]I once was lost, but [G]now am found
[C]Was blind, but [F]now I [C]see

[C]'Twas grace that [G]taught my heart to [A7]fear
And grace my [F]fears re[C]lieved
[C]How precious did [G]that grace ap[A7]pear
The hour I [F]first be[C]lieved

[C]Through many dangers, [G]toils and snares
[A7]I have already [F]come
[C]'Tis grace has [G]brought me safe [C]thus far
And [F]grace will [C]lead me [G]home

title: Wonderwall
lyrics:
[Em]Today is gonna be the day that they're gonna throw it back to you
[G]By now you should've somehow realized what you gotta do
[D]I don't believe that anybody feels the way I do[A7] about you now

[Em]Backbeat, the word is on the street that the fire in your heart is out
[G]I'm sure you've heard it all before but you never really had a doubt
[D]I don't believe that anybody feels the way I do[A7] about you now

[C]And all the roads we have to walk are [G]winding
[C]And all the lights that lead us there are [G]blinding
[D]There are many things that I would[A7] like to say to you
But I don't know [G]how

[C]Because maybe [Em7]you're gonna be the one that saves me [G]
And after all [Em7]you're my wonderwall [G]

[C]Today was gonna be the day but they'll never throw it back to you
[G]By now you should've somehow realized what you're not to do
[D]I don't believe that anybody feels the way I do[A7] about you now

title: Country Roads
lyrics:
[G]Almost heaven, West [D]Virginia
[Em]Blue Ridge Mountains, [C]Shenandoah [G]River
[G]Life is old there, [D]older than the trees
[Em]Younger than the mountains, [C]growin' like a [G]breeze

[G]Country roads, take me [D]home
To the [Em]place I be[C]long
[G]West Virginia, mountain [D]mama
Take me [C]home, country [G]roads

[G]All my memories, [D]gather 'round her
[Em]Miner's lady, [C]stranger to blue [G]water
[G]Dark and dusty, [D]painted on the sky
[Em]Misty taste of moonshine, [C]teardrop in my [G]eye

title: Hallelujah
lyrics:
[C]Now I've heard there was a [Am]secret chord
[C]That David played and it [Am]pleased the Lord
[F]But you don't really [G]care for music, [C]do you? [G]

[C]It goes like this, the [Am]fourth, the fifth
[C]The minor fall, the [Am]major lift
[F]The baffled king [G]composing [E7]Halle[Am]lujah

[F]Hallelujah, [G]Hallelujah
[F]Hallelujah, [G]Halle[C]lujah

[C]Your faith was strong but you [Am]needed proof
[C]You saw her bathing [Am]on the roof
[F]Her beauty and the [G]moonlight over[C]threw you [G]

[C]She tied you to her [Am]kitchen chair
[C]She broke your throne and she [Am]cut your hair
[F]And from your lips she [G]drew the [E7]Halle[Am]lujah

[F]Hallelujah, [G]Hallelujah
[F]Hallelujah, [G]Halle[C]lujah

title: Hotel California
lyrics:
[Bm]On a dark desert highway, [F#]cool wind in my hair
[A]Warm smell of colitas, [E]rising up through the air[G] [D]
[Bm]Up ahead in the distance, [F#]I saw a shimmering light
[A]My head grew heavy and my [E]sight grew dim, [G]I had to stop for the [D]night

[Bm]There she stood in the doorway; [F#]I heard the mission bell
[A]And I was thinking to myself, [E]"This could be Heaven or this [G]could be Hell" [D]
[Bm]Then she lit up a candle [F#]and she showed me the way
[A]There were voices down the corridor, [E]I thought I heard them say[G] [D]

[G]"Welcome to the Hotel Cali[D]fornia
[F#]Such a lovely place (Such a lovely place)
[Bm]Such a lovely face
[G]Plenty of room at the Hotel Cali[D]fornia
[F#]Any time of year (Any time of year)
[Bm]You can find it here"

[Em]Her mind is Tiffany-twisted, [Bm]she got the Mercedes bends
[G]She got a lot of pretty, pretty boys [D]that she calls friends
[A]How they dance in the courtyard, [E]sweet summer sweat.
[G]Some dance to remember, [D]some dance to forget

title: Shape of You
lyrics:
[C#m]The club isn't the best place to find a lover
[A]So the bar is where I go
[B]Me and my friends at the table doing shots
[G#]Drinking fast and then we talk slow

[C#m]You come over and start up a conversation with just me
[A]And trust me I'll give it a chance now
[B]Take my hand, stop, put Van the Man on the jukebox
[G#]And then we start to dance

[A]And now I'm singing like
[B]Girl, you know I want your love
[G#m]Your love was handmade for somebody like me
[C#m]So come on, be my baby, come on, come on, be my baby
[A]Come on, come on, be my baby, be my baby
[B]Look, I'm singing like
[G#m]Girl, you know I want your love
[C#m]Your love was handmade for somebody like me
[A]So come on, be my baby, come on, come on, be my baby
[B]Come on, come on, be my baby, be my baby

title: Jolene
lyrics:
[C]Jolene, Jolene, Jolene, Jo[G7]lene
I'm begging of you, please don't take my [C]man

[C]Jolene, Jolene, Jolene, Jo[G7]lene
Please don't take him just because you [C]can

[C]Your beauty is beyond compare
With [F]flaming locks of auburn hair
With [C]ivory skin and eyes of [G7]emerald green
[C]Your smile is like a breath of spring
Your [F]voice is soft like summer rain
And [C]I cannot compete with you, Jo[G7]lene

[C]He talks about you in his sleep
There's [F]nothing I can do to keep
From [C]crying when he calls your [G7]name, Jo[C]lene

[C]Jolene, Jolene, Jolene, Jo[G7]lene
I'm begging of you, please don't take my [C]man

[C]Jolene, Jolene, Jolene, Jo[G7]lene
Please don't take him just because you [C]can
